intro: Racosperma brownianum, commonly known as the Brownian wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring compound leaves and yellow flowers arranged in racemes. It is often found in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
